nexttext:
Integrating, we get the desired inequality  
$\tau \big(\delta (a^{1+\theta}-b^{1+\theta})\big){\geqslant} \tau \big( \delta^{2+\theta}\big).$

\smallskip

{\it Case 1.b:} $\delta$ arbitrary with decomposition $\delta_+-\delta_-$ into positive and negative parts. We reduce it to the previous case by introducing $\alpha=a+\delta_-=b+\delta_+$, so that $\alpha{\geqslant} a,b$.
We have
\begin{eqnarray*}
\tau\big( (a-b)(a^{p-1}-b^{p-1})\big)&=&\tau\big( (a-\alpha)(a^{p-1}-\alpha^{p-1})\big)+\tau\big( (a-\alpha)(\alpha^{p-1}-b^{p-1})\big)\\ & & \;\;+\tau\big( (\alpha-b)(\alpha^{p-1}-b^{p-1})\big)+\tau\big( (\alpha-b)(a^{p-1}-\alpha^{p-1})\big).
\end{eqnarray*}
The first and the third terms are bigger than $\tau\big( \delta_-^p\big)$ and 
$\tau\big( \delta_+^p\big)$ by Case 1.a. Hence it suffices to check that the two remaining terms are positive. We use again the integral formula \eqref{intfor} and $\delta_+\delta_-=0$ and positivity of the trace
\begin{eqnarray*}
\tau\big( -\delta_-(\alpha^{p-1}-b^{p-1})\big)&=&-c_\theta \int_{{\mathbb{R}}_+} t^\theta
\tau\Big( \delta_-\big( \delta_+ + t^2 (b+\delta_++t)^{-1}-t^2(b+t)^{-1}\big)\Big)\frac{{\rm d}t}{t}\\
&=& c_\theta \int_{{\mathbb{R}}_+} t^\theta t^2
\tau\Big( \delta_-\big(  (b+t)^{-1}-(b+\delta_++t)^{-1}\big)\Big)\frac{{\rm d}t}{t}{\geqslant} 0.
\end{eqnarray*}
The last term is handled similarly.

\medskip

b(b+t)^{-1}b^n\Big)\frac{{\rm d}t}{t}\\&=& \tau\big( \delta^2
b^{n+\theta}\big)=\tau\big( \delta^2
b^{p-2}\big),

and $0{\leqslant} (b+t)^{-1}b^n$.

\begin{eqnarray*}\tau\big(\delta\big( (b+\delta)^{1+\theta}-b^{1+\theta}\big)b^{n}\big)&=&
c_\theta \int_{{\mathbb{R}}_+} t^\theta \tau\Big( \delta \big( \delta + t^2
(b+\delta+t)^{-1}-t^2(b+t)^{-1}\big)b^n\Big)\frac{{\rm d}t}{t}\\ &=&
c_\theta \int_{{\mathbb{R}}_+} t^\theta\tau\Big( \delta \big( \delta - t^2
(b+\delta+t)^{-1}\delta(b+t)^{-1}\big)b^n\Big)\frac{{\rm
    d}t}{t}\\ &{\geqslant} & c_\theta \int_{{\mathbb{R}}_+} t^\theta\tau\Big( \delta
\big( \delta - t\delta(b+t)^{-1}\big)b^n\Big)\frac{{\rm
    d}t}{t}\\ &=&c_\theta \int_{{\mathbb{R}}_+} t^\theta\tau\Big( \delta^2
b(b+t)^{-1}b^n\Big)\frac{{\rm d}t}{t}\\&=& \tau\big( \delta^2
b^{n+\theta}\big)=\tau\big( \delta^2
b^{p-2}\big),
\end{eqnarray*}
where we used again positivity of the trace with $(b+\delta+t)^{-1}{\leqslant} t^{-1}$
and $0{\leqslant} (b+t)^{-1}b^n$.

Assuming ${\mathcal{M}}$ finite and $a=b+\delta,b\in {\mathcal{M}}^{++}$ as above, the alternative proof when $p\in[3,4]$ relies on Lemma \ref{diff}:
\begin{eqnarray*}
\tau\big( (a-b)(a^{p-1}-b^{p-1})\big)&=&p\int_0^1 
\int_0^1 \tau\Big( \delta \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2}(\delta) \Big)\;{\rm d}t\;{\rm d}u\\
&=&p\int_0^1 \int_0^1 \langle \delta, \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2} (\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\;{\rm d}t\;{\rm d}u
\end{eqnarray*}

As $p-2\in [1,2]$, $f_{p-2}$ is operator convex, so that for any 
$m\in {\mathbb{B}}(L_2({\mathcal{M}}))^+$ and any projection ${\mathcal{E}}\in  {\mathbb{B}}(L_2({\mathcal{M}}))$, we have
${\mathcal{E}} m^{p-2}{\mathcal{E}} {\geqslant} \big({\mathcal{E}} m {\mathcal{E}})^{p-2}$. We choose ${\mathcal{E}}$ to be the 
$L_2$-conditional expectation onto the subalgebra generated by $\delta$.
\begin{eqnarray*}
\langle \delta, \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2} (\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})} &=& \langle \delta, {\mathcal{E}} \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2}{\mathcal{E}} (\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\\
&{\geqslant} & \langle \delta, \Big( t {\mathcal{E}} L_{b+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}}  +(1-t){\mathcal{E}} R_{b+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}} \Big)^{p-2}(\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\nonumber\\
&=& \langle \delta, \Big( t  L_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}}  +(1-t) R_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}} \Big)^{p-2}(\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\nonumber\\
&=& \langle \delta, \Big( t  L_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta}  +(1-t) R_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta} \Big)^{p-2}(\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})},
\end{eqnarray*}
where in the last equality we have used that $R_x$ and ${\mathcal{E}}$ commute if $x\in \delta''$. Tracking back the equalities, we obtain

$\|{\varphi}(x)\|_{p'}= \|x\|_p^{p-1}$. When restricted to $L_p({\mathcal{M}})^+$, it is exactly $f_{p-1}$, so the result can be written as: for $a,\,b\in L_p({\mathcal{M}})^+$

The above computations yield that the left-hand side  is $\frac{a^p-b^p}{a-b}$ if $a\neq b$ and $pa^{p-1}$ if $a=b$ which clearly coincide with the right-hand side. 
\end{proof}



Assuming ${\mathcal{M}}$ finite and $a=b+\delta,b\in {\mathcal{M}}^{++}$ as above, the alternative proof when $p\in[3,4]$ relies on Lemma \ref{diff}:
\begin{eqnarray*}
\tau\big( (a-b)(a^{p-1}-b^{p-1})\big)&=&p\int_0^1 
\int_0^1 \tau\Big( \delta \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2}(\delta) \Big)\;{\rm d}t\;{\rm d}u\\
&=&p\int_0^1 \int_0^1 \langle \delta, \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2} (\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\;{\rm d}t\;{\rm d}u
\end{eqnarray*}

As $p-2\in [1,2]$, $f_{p-2}$ is operator convex, so that for any 
$m\in {\mathbb{B}}(L_2({\mathcal{M}}))^+$ and any projection ${\mathcal{E}}\in  {\mathbb{B}}(L_2({\mathcal{M}}))$, we have
${\mathcal{E}} m^{p-2}{\mathcal{E}} {\geqslant} \big({\mathcal{E}} m {\mathcal{E}})^{p-2}$. We choose ${\mathcal{E}}$ to be the 
$L_2$-conditional expectation onto the subalgebra generated by $\delta$.
\begin{eqnarray*}
\langle \delta, \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2} (\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})} &=& \langle \delta, {\mathcal{E}} \Big( t L_{b+u\delta} +(1-t)R_{b+u\delta}\Big)^{p-2}{\mathcal{E}} (\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\\
&{\geqslant} & \langle \delta, \Big( t {\mathcal{E}} L_{b+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}}  +(1-t){\mathcal{E}} R_{b+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}} \Big)^{p-2}(\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\nonumber\\
&=& \langle \delta, \Big( t  L_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}}  +(1-t) R_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta}{\mathcal{E}} \Big)^{p-2}(\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})}\nonumber\\
&=& \langle \delta, \Big( t  L_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta}  +(1-t) R_{{\mathcal{E}}(b)+u\delta} \Big)^{p-2}(\delta)\rangle_{L_2({\mathcal{M}})},
\end{eqnarray*}
where in the last equality we have used that $R_x$ and ${\mathcal{E}}$ commute if $x\in \delta''$. Tracking back the equalities, we obtain
